verses.text: \w Dead|strong="H4194"\w* \w flies|strong="H2070"\w* cause the \w ointment|strong="H8081"\w* of the \w apothecary|strong="H7543"\w* to send \w forth|strong="H5042"\w* a stinking \w savour|strong="H0887"\w*: \add so doth\add* a \w little|strong="H4592"\w* \w folly|strong="H5531"\w* him that is in \w reputation|strong="H3368"\w* for \w wisdom|strong="H2451"\w* \add and\add* \w honour|strong="H3519"\w*.\f + \fr 10.1 \ft Dead…: Heb. Flies of death\f*

A wise \w man’s|strong="H2450"\w* \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* \add is\add* at his right \w hand|strong="H3225"\w*; but a \w fool’s|strong="H3684"\w* \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* at his \w left|strong="H8040"\w*.

Yea also, when he that is a \w fool|strong="H5530"\w* \w walketh|strong="H1980"\w* by the \w way|strong="H1870"\w*, his \w wisdom|strong="H3820"\w* \w faileth|strong="H2638"\w* \add him\add*, and he \w saith|strong="H0559"\w* to every one \add that\add* he \add is\add* a \w fool|strong="H5530"\w*.\f + \fr 10.3 \ft his…: Heb. his heart\f*

If the \w spirit|strong="H7307"\w* of the \w ruler|strong="H4910"\w* rise \w up|strong="H5927"\w* against thee, \w leave|strong="H3240"\w* not thy \w place|strong="H4725"\w*; for \w yielding|strong="H4832"\w* \w pacifieth|strong="H3240"\w* \w great|strong="H1419"\w* \w offences|strong="H2399"\w*.

There \w is|strong="H3426"\w* an \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* \add which\add* I have \w seen|strong="H7200"\w* under the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w*, as an \w error|strong="H7684"\w* \add which\add* \w proceedeth|strong="H3318"\w* \w from|strong="H6440"\w* the \w ruler|strong="H7989"\w*:\f + \fr 10.5 \ft from: Heb. from before\f*

\w Folly|strong="H5529"\w* is \w set|strong="H5414"\w* in \w great|strong="H7227"\w* \w dignity|strong="H4791"\w*, and the \w rich|strong="H6223"\w* \w sit|strong="H3427"\w* in low \w place|strong="H8216"\w*.\f + \fr 10.6 \ft in great…: Heb. in great heights\f*

I have \w seen|strong="H7200"\w* \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* upon \w horses|strong="H5483"\w*, and \w princes|strong="H8269"\w* \w walking|strong="H1980"\w* as \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* upon the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w*.

He that \w diggeth|strong="H2658"\w* a \w pit|strong="H1475"\w* shall \w fall|strong="H5307"\w* into it; and whoso \w breaketh|strong="H6555"\w* an \w hedge|strong="H1447"\w*, a \w serpent|strong="H5175"\w* shall \w bite|strong="H5391"\w* him.

Whoso \w removeth|strong="H5265"\w* \w stones|strong="H0068"\w* shall be \w hurt|strong="H6087"\w* therewith; \add and\add* he that \w cleaveth|strong="H1234"\w* \w wood|strong="H6086"\w* shall be \w endangered|strong="H5533"\w* thereby.

If the \w iron|strong="H1270"\w* be \w blunt|strong="H6949"\w*, and he do not \w whet|strong="H7043"\w* the \w edge|strong="H6440"\w*, then must he \w put|strong="H1396"\w* to more \w strength|strong="H2428"\w*: but \w wisdom|strong="H2451"\w* \add is\add* \w profitable|strong="H3504"\w* to \w direct|strong="H3787"\w*.

Surely the \w serpent|strong="H5175"\w* will \w bite|strong="H5391"\w* without \w enchantment|strong="H3908"\w*; and a \w babbler|strong="H3956"\w* is no \w better|strong="H3504"\w*.\f + \fr 10.11 \ft a babbler: Heb. the master of the tongue\f*

The \w words|strong="H1697"\w* of a wise \w man’s|strong="H2450"\w* \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w* \add are\add* \w gracious|strong="H2580"\w*; but the \w lips|strong="H8193"\w* of a \w fool|strong="H3684"\w* will swallow \w up|strong="H1104"\w* himself.\f + \fr 10.12 \ft gracious: Heb. grace\f*

The \w beginning|strong="H8462"\w* of the \w words|strong="H1697"\w* of his \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w* \add is\add* \w foolishness|strong="H5531"\w*: and the \w end|strong="H0319"\w* of his \w talk|strong="H6310"\w* \add is\add* \w mischievous|strong="H7451"\w* \w madness|strong="H1948"\w*.\f + \fr 10.13 \ft his talk: Heb. his mouth\f*

A \w fool|strong="H5530"\w* also is \w full|strong="H7235"\w* of \w words|strong="H1697"\w*: a \w man|strong="H0120"\w* cannot \w tell|strong="H3045"\w* what shall be; and what shall be \w after|strong="H0310"\w* him, who can \w tell|strong="H5046"\w* him?\f + \fr 10.14 \ft is full…: Heb. multiplieth words\f*

The \w labour|strong="H5999"\w* of the \w foolish|strong="H3684"\w* \w wearieth|strong="H3021"\w* every one of them, because he \w knoweth|strong="H3045"\w* not how to \w go|strong="H3212"\w* to the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*.

¶ \w Woe|strong="H0337"\w* to thee, O \w land|strong="H0776"\w*, when thy \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \add is\add* a \w child|strong="H5288"\w*, and thy \w princes|strong="H8269"\w* \w eat|strong="H0398"\w* in the \w morning|strong="H1242"\w*!

\w Blessed|strong="H0835"\w* \add art\add* thou, O \w land|strong="H0776"\w*, when thy \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \add is\add* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w nobles|strong="H2715"\w*, and thy \w princes|strong="H8269"\w* \w eat|strong="H0398"\w* in due \w season|strong="H6256"\w*, for \w strength|strong="H1369"\w*, and not for \w drunkenness|strong="H8358"\w*!

¶ By much \w slothfulness|strong="H6103"\w* the \w building|strong="H4746"\w* \w decayeth|strong="H4355"\w*; and through \w idleness|strong="H8220"\w* of the \w hands|strong="H3027"\w* the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* droppeth \w through|strong="H1811"\w*.

¶ A \w feast|strong="H3899"\w* is \w made|strong="H6213"\w* for \w laughter|strong="H7814"\w*, and \w wine|strong="H3196"\w* maketh \w merry|strong="H8055"\w*: but \w money|strong="H3701"\w* \w answereth|strong="H6030"\w* all \add things\add*.\f + \fr 10.19 \ft maketh…: Heb. maketh glad the life\f*

¶ \w Curse|strong="H7043"\w* not the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, no not in thy \w thought|strong="H4093"\w*; and \w curse|strong="H7043"\w* not the \w rich|strong="H6223"\w* in thy \w bedchamber|strong="H2315"\w*: for a \w bird|strong="H5775"\w* of the \w air|strong="H8064"\w* shall \w carry|strong="H3212"\w* the \w voice|strong="H6963"\w*, and that which \w hath|strong="H1167"\w* \w wings|strong="H3671"\w* shall \w tell|strong="H5046"\w* the \w matter|strong="H1697"\w*.\f + \fr 10.20 \ft thought: or, conscience\f*
